pageProps.content:
![The 2nd Tunnel - Cheorwon (Ï†ú2ÎïÖÍµ¥ (Ï≤†Ïõê))](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657165_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The 2nd Tunnel, which was made by North Koreans to invade South Korea, was discovered on March 24, 1975. This tunnel is 3.5 kilometers long and sits 50~160 meters below the surface. It stretches out 1.1 kilometers and 2.4 kilometers in the south and north directions respectively. Only 500 meters is open for tourism among the whole length. Inside of the tunnel, there is a plaza to gather a large military force. The tunnel is divided into 3 exits. The use of this tunnel would allow for thirty thousand armed forces as well as tanks to pass through per hour. For now, the tunnel is operated as part of Cheorwon Security Tourism Course and many tourists visit this area every year. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-450-5559| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|Tuesdays, New Year's Day, Children's Day (May 5), Seollal (Lunar New Year's Day) & Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving Day) Holidays| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Tour Course Information:|[Tour Course]
* From Goseokjeong Land
Goseokjeong Land - The 2nd Tunnel - Cheorwon Peace Observatory (monorail included) ‚Äì Cheorwon Durumi Hall (Crane Pavilion) - Woljeong-ri Station

* From Baengmagoji Station
Baengmagoji Station ‚Äì The 2nd Tunnel ‚Äì Peace Observatory ‚Äì Woljeong-ri Station - Baengmagoji Station| |Restrooms:|Available| |Facility Utilization Fees:|[Shuttle Bus]

* Separate fees apply for parking and admission

Individuals - Adults 4,000 won / Teenagers 3,000 won / Children & Senior citizens 2,000 won
Groups - Adults 3,000 won / Teenagers 2,000 won / Children & Senior citizens 1,500 won

[Monorail]

Groups - Adults 1,500 won / Teenagers 1,000 won / Children 700 won / Senior citizens 750 won
* Free: Babies (ages 6 & under)

* Adults (ages 19 & over) / Teenagers (ages 13-18) / Children (ages 7-12) / Senior citizens (ages 65 & over)| |Parking Fees:|[Daily]

Large Vehicles: 5,000 won
| |Restrooms:|Available| |Available Facilities:|The 2nd Tunnel, Cheorwon Peace Observatory, Woljeong-ri Station, Cheorwon Durumi Hall (Crane Pavilion)| ## Detail Image ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602357_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602357_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602358_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602358_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602365_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/602365_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657166_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657166_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657168_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657168_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657169_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-15-1665827240024/657169_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-450-5559](tel:+82334505559) - [üè†www.cwg.go.kr (Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
hantan.cwg.go.kr](http://www.cwg.go.kr/site/tour/main.do) ```googleMap latitude: 38.1879930099 longitude: 127.2893135057 title: 1825, Taebong-ro, Cheorwon-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take an intercity bus to Dongsong-eup Bus Terminal.
From Dongsong-eup Bus Terminal, take a city bus bound for Sintan-ri and get off at Sintan-ri Bus Stop.
The bus passes through the Cheorwon Korean Workers' Party Headquarters and Baengmagoji Battlefield.

data.title: The 2nd Tunnel - Cheorwon (Ï†ú2ÎïÖÍµ¥ (Ï≤†Ïõê))
data.description: The 2nd Tunnel, which was made by North Koreans to invade South Korea, was discovered on March 24, 1975. This tunnel is 3.5 kilometers long and sits 50~160 meters below the surface. It stretches out 1.1 kilometers and 2.4 kilometers in the south and north directions respectively. Only 500 meters is open for tourism among the whole length. Inside of the tunnel, there is a plaza to gather a large military force. The tunnel is divided into 3 exits. The use of this tunnel would allow for thirty thousand armed forces as well as tanks to pass through per hour. For now, the tunnel is operated as part of Cheorwon Security Tourism Course and many tourists visit this area every year.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Guryongpokpo Falls (Sogeumgang River) (Íµ¨Î£°Ìè≠Ìè¨ (ÏÜåÍ∏àÍ∞ï))
dataList.description: Guryongpokpo Falls refers to the group of nine waterfalls, varying in size, located over a three-kilometer stretch of Sogeumgang River in Odaesan National Park. Guryong means nine dragons and legend has it that each of the waterfalls was occupied by a dragon. The sixth waterfall is particularly attractive. It is simultaneously the most magnificent and serene of the falls, which is why it is also known as the Gentleman‚Äôs Waterfall. Two kilometers away from the sixth waterfall, is a curious-looking piece of rock called Manmulsang. The name literally means tens of thousands of different looks. Some of these looks have earned it to other names such as Giant Rock, Phantom-Face Rock, Iworam, and Candlestick Rock‚Äô
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gongjicheon Recreation Area (Í≥µÏßÄÏ≤úÏú†ÏõêÏßÄ)
dataList.description: The area of Gongjicheon Stream connected to the Bukhangang River is a shelter in the middle of Chuncheon City. This recreation area comprises various facilities along both sides of the Gongjicheon Stream, including Gongjicheon Sculpture Park, Uiam Park, Memorial Hall for Ethiopian Veterans in the Korean War, inline skating rink, outdoor stage, and fountain. Visitors can cross the water easily through the Gongjicheon Bridge and the lower pedestrian bridge. The waterside trail and the bike path are popular among citizens with the seasonal scenic view. In particular, cherry blossom attracts many visitors in spring. There is a bicycle rental stand nearby the stream. It is recommended to enjoy biking around the Gongjicheon Stream or along the Uiamho Bike Path. Another interesting ride is a pedal boat with which visitors can create a romantic memory with a splendid scenery of the Gongjicheon Stream.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangneung Coffee Street (Í∞ïÎ¶âÏª§ÌîºÍ±∞Î¶¨)
dataList.description: Gangneung in Gangwon-do is the first local district in Korea to host a coffee festival and support coffee artisans as well as promote development of coffee related facilities and contents such as a coffee museum, coffee street, coffee factory, barista academy, and more. With almost all coffee shops in the area roasting their own coffee beans, Gangneung is well-recognized as the city of coffee.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangmun Beach (Í∞ïÎ¨∏Ìï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description: Located in Gangmun-dong, Gangmun Beach is lined with fresh hoe (sliced raw fish) restaurants along Gangmunhang Port. The beach has accommodations nearby and is in close proximity to the Gyeongpo area, making it a great vacation destination. Not only is the beach a well-known diving spot among scuba divers for its deep waters and abundant marine life, but its dock is also popular among fishers all year round.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm (ÎåÄÍ¥ÄÎ†π ÏÇºÏñëÎ™©Ïû•)
dataList.description: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm is a livestock farm opened in 1972 to source product for Samyang Food, then opened as a tourist attraction in 2007 making it open to the public. The animals are free to roam the large ranch fields and the wind generator on top of the hill is the largest in Korea to create natural energy. At the farm, visitors can take in the beautiful scenery, watch a sheep herding performance, feed sheep and ostrich, and so much more. There are various Samyang products sold at the ranch mart as well as organic milk products to try as well.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Oksanga - Okgwangsan Jade Mine (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Ïò•ÏÇ∞Í∞Ä (Ïò•Í¥ëÏÇ∞))
dataList.description: This tourist destination was established as a healing and experience attraction based on Korea‚Äôs only jade mine in Chuncheon. It comprises Jade Cave Experience Center, Jade Mine Sauna, Toy Museum, Bakery Cafe, restaurant, and other facilities. In particular, Jade Cave Experience Center, which was built by using an actual jade pit, invites visitors to observe and touch rough gemstones. The center has a shelter surrounded by jade stones and an earthenware museum, which exhibits various types of earthenware. If you want to have a healing experience with jade‚Äôs energy, the jade sauna is an ideal place to visit. The sauna was built with high-quality nephrite from the jade mine and uses mineral water produced from deep in the jade pit. Moon Valley consisting of a gallery, modern history museum, and toy museum is popular among family visitors with children, and kidults too. The toy museum is full of famous character figures from animated films and popular movies, such as Taekwon V, Mazinger Z, Disney characters, and Star Wars characters. The outdoor park behind the Moon Valley has a small zoo and a walking path.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Mulgil-ro (Ï∂òÏ≤úÎ¨ºÎ†àÍ∏∏)
dataList.description: The Mullegil Trail is designed to guide tourists to enjoy the beautiful scenery along the waterway in Chuncheon, a lake city. The Mullegil Trail also offers tourists an opportunity to travel around Chuncheon‚Äôs lake and river by canoe. With basic instructions, people of all ages can go canoeing easily. Many companies provide diverse canoeing courses, and their common course starts from the Chuncheon Songam Sports Town, continues to canoe toward the Uiamho Lake Skywalk, and returns. Tourists can enjoy canoeing along the Chuncheon Mullegil Trail and use the King Canoe Quay, which is equipped with a facility for the vulnerable people on tourism. Selected as an open tourist attraction, the King Canoe Quay provides canoeing programs for people in wheelchairs and the visually impaired.
dataList.author: korea-tour
